verses.text: Give ear, O ye heavens, and I will speak; And hear, O earth, the words of my mouth.
My doctrine shall drop as the rain, My speech shall distil as the dew, As the small rain upon the tender herb, And as the showers upon the grass:
Because I will publish the name of the \sc Lord\sc*: Ascribe ye greatness unto our God.
\add He is\add* the Rock, his work \add is\add* perfect: For all his ways \add are\add* judgment: A God of truth and without iniquity, Just and right \add is\add* he.
They have corrupted themselves, their spot \add is\add* not \add the spot\add* of his children: \add They are\add* a perverse and crooked generation.
Do ye thus requite the \sc Lord\sc*, O foolish people and unwise? \add Is\add* not he thy Father \add that\add* hath bought thee? Hath he \add not\add* made thee, and established thee?
Remember the days of old, Consider the years of many generations: Ask thy father, and he will shew thee; Thy elders, and they will tell thee.
When the most High divided to the nations their inheritance, When he separated the sons of Adam, He set the bounds of the people According to the number of the children of Israel.
For the \sc Lordâ€™s\sc* portion \add is\add* his people; Jacob \add is\add* the lot of his inheritance.
He found him in a desert land, And in the waste howling wilderness; He led him about, he instructed him, He kept him as the apple of his eye.
As an eagle stirreth up her nest, Fluttereth over her young, Spreadeth abroad her wings, taketh them, Beareth them on her wings:
\add So\add* the \sc Lord\sc* alone did lead him, And \add there was\add* no strange god with him.
He made him ride on the high places of the earth, That he might eat the increase of the fields; And he made him to suck honey out of the rock, And oil out of the flinty rock;
Butter of kine, and milk of sheep, With fat of lambs, and rams of the breed of Bashan, And goats, with the fat of kidneys of wheat; And thou didst drink the pure blood of the grape.

But Jeshurun waxed fat, and kicked: Thou art waxed fat, thou art grown thick, thou art covered \add with fatness;\add* Then he forsook God \add which\add* made him, And lightly esteemed the Rock of his salvation.
They provoked him to jealousy with strange \add gods\add*, With abominations provoked they him to anger.
They sacrificed unto devils, not \add to\add* God; \add To\add* gods whom they knew not, \add To\add* new \add gods that\add* came newly up, Whom your fathers feared not.
Of the Rock \add that\add* begat thee thou art unmindful, And hast forgotten God that formed thee.
And when the \sc Lord\sc* saw \add it\add*, he abhorred \add them\add*, Because of the provoking of his sons, and of his daughters.
And he said, I will hide my face from them, I will see what their end \add shall be:\add* For they \add are\add* a very froward generation, Children in whom \add is\add* no faith.

They have moved me to jealousy with \add that which is\add* not God; They have provoked me to anger with their vanities: And I will move them to jealousy with \add those which are\add* not a people; I will provoke them to anger with a foolish nation.
For a fire is kindled in my anger, And shall burn unto the lowest hell, And shall consume the earth with her increase, And set on fire the foundations of the mountains.
I will heap mischiefs upon them; I will spend mine arrows upon them.
\add They shall be\add* burnt with hunger, and devoured with burning heat, And with bitter destruction: I will also send the teeth of beasts upon them, With the poison of serpents of the dust.
The sword without, And terror within, shall destroy Both the young man and the virgin, The suckling \add also\add* with the man of gray hairs.
I said, I would scatter them into corners, I would make the remembrance of them to cease from among men:

Were it not that I feared the wrath of the enemy, Lest their adversaries should behave themselves strangely, \add And\add* lest they should say, Our hand is high, And the \sc Lord\sc* hath not done all this.
For they \add are\add* a nation void of counsel, Neither \add is there any\add* understanding in them.
O that they were wise, \add that\add* they understood this, \add That\add* they would consider their latter end!
How should one chase a thousand, And two put ten thousand to flight, Except their Rock had sold them, And the \sc Lord\sc* had shut them up?
For their rock \add is\add* not as our Rock, Even our enemies themselves \add being\add* judges.
For their vine \add is\add* of the vine of Sodom, And of the fields of Gomorrah: Their grapes \add are\add* grapes of gall, Their clusters \add are\add* bitter:
Their wine \add is\add* the poison of dragons, And the cruel venom of asps.
\add Is\add* not this laid up in store with me, \add And\add* sealed up among my treasures?

To me \add belongeth\add* vengeance, and recompence; Their foot shall slide in \add due\add* time: For the day of their calamity \add is\add* at hand, And the things that shall come upon them make haste.
For the \sc Lord\sc* shall judge his people, And repent himself for his servants, When he seeth that \add their\add* power is gone, And \add there is\add* none shut up, or left.
And he shall say, Where \add are\add* their gods, \add Their\add* rock in whom they trusted,
Which did eat the fat of their sacrifices, \add And\add* drank the wine of their drink offerings? Let them rise up and help you, \add And\add* be your protection.

See now that I, \add even\add* I, \add am\add* he, And \add there is\add* no god with me: I kill, and I make alive; I wound, and I heal: Neither \add is there any\add* that can deliver out of my hand.
For I lift up my hand to heaven, And say, I live for ever.
If I whet my glittering sword, And mine hand take hold on judgment; I will render vengeance to mine enemies, And will reward them that hate me.
I will make mine arrows drunk with blood, And my sword shall devour flesh; \add And that\add* with the blood of the slain and of the captives, From the beginning of revenges upon the enemy.

Rejoice, O ye nations, \add with\add* his people: For he will avenge the blood of his servants, And will render vengeance to his adversaries, And will be merciful \add unto\add* his land, \add and to\add* his people.
And Moses came and spake all the words of this song in the ears of the people, he and Hoshea the son of Nun.
And Moses made an end of speaking all these words to all Israel:
and he said unto them, Set your hearts unto all the words which I testify among you \add this\add* day, which ye shall command your children to observe to do, all the words of this law.
For it \add is\add* not a vain thing for you; because it \add is\add* your life: and through this thing ye shall prolong \add your\add* days in the land, whither ye go over Jordan to possess it.
And the \sc Lord\sc* spake unto Moses that selfsame day, saying,

Get thee up into this mountain Abarim, \add unto\add* mount Nebo, which \add is\add* in the land of Moab, that \add is\add* over against Jericho; and behold the land of Canaan, which I give unto the children of Israel for a possession:
and die in the mount whither thou goest up, and be gathered unto thy people; as Aaron thy brother died in mount Hor, and was gathered unto his people:
because ye trespassed against me among the children of Israel at the waters of Meribah-Kadesh, \add in\add* the wilderness of Zin; because ye sanctified me not in the midst of the children of Israel.
Yet thou shalt see the land before \add thee;\add* but thou shalt not go thither unto the land which I give the children of Israel.
